quizzes.question: What is the time complexity of Insertion Sort in the best case?
quizzes.explanation: When the array is already sorted, each insertion only needs one comparison.

quizzes.question: Why is Insertion Sort considered a stable sorting algorithm?
options: Because it maintains the relative order of equal elements
Because it divides the array into halves
quizzes.answer: Because it maintains the relative order of equal elements
quizzes.explanation: During insertion, equal elements are never swapped, preserving order.

quizzes.question: Which scenario benefits most from Insertion Sort?
quizzes.explanation: Insertion sort adapts well when data is already close to sorted, approaching O(n) time.

quizzes.question: How many passes does Insertion Sort make for an array of size n?
quizzes.explanation: Each element from index 1 to n-1 is considered once for insertion.

quizzes.question: What happens when Insertion Sort encounters a reverse-sorted array?
options: It runs in O(n log n)
quizzes.explanation: Each element must be compared and shifted all the way to the beginning.

hackerrank_questions.title: Insertion Sort - Part 1
hackerrank_questions.description: Simulate the insertion of one element into a sorted subarray. Print the array at each shift until the element is inserted in the correct position.

hackerrank_questions.title: Insertion Sort - Part 2
hackerrank_questions.description: Implement full insertion sort and print the array after each iteration.

hackerrank_questions.title: Running Time of Algorithms
hackerrank_questions.description: Determine the number of shifts that occur during an insertion sort to measure its running time.
